intro: Saxifraga maweana, commonly known as the Maweana saxifrage, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the Saxifragaceae family and is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color, blooming during the warmer months. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in dry, sunny habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
